label: 東大寺
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 57th  . Nara National Museum . 2005
説明文: Established in 728 as Konshuji by Emperor Shōmu, it later became the head Kokubunji temple, and then Tōdaiji, head temple of the six sects of Nara Buddhism. Today, it is the head temple of the Kegon sect. It houses the Great Buddha in its Daibutsuden and stores Nara-period artifacts in its repository the Shōsō-in. [金鐘寺、聖武天皇、国分寺、華厳宗、大仏殿、正倉院]
